solution_line_template: The milk cost ${milk_original_cost} but was on sale for 1/2 off so {milk_original_cost}*{milk_discount_fraction} = $<<{milk_original_cost}*{milk_discount_fraction}={milk_cost_after_discount}>>{milk_cost_after_discount}

She bought {banana_pounds} pounds of bananas at ${banana_price_per_pound} per pound so {banana_pounds} *.{banana_price_per_pound} = $<<{banana_pounds}*{banana_price_per_pound}={banana_cost}>>{banana_cost}

She had a ${detergent_coupon_value} coupon off of laundry detergent so {detergent_original_cost} - {detergent_coupon_value} = $<<{detergent_original_cost}-{detergent_coupon_value}={detergent_cost_after_coupon}>>{detergent_cost_after_coupon}

When you add all of her purchases together then {milk_cost_after_discount} + {banana_cost} +{bread_cost} + {detergent_cost_after_coupon} = $<<{milk_cost_after_discount}+{banana_cost}+{bread_cost}+{detergent_cost_after_coupon}={total_purchases_cost}>>{total_purchases_cost}
She paid with a ${initial_bill} bill so {initial_bill}-{total_purchases_cost} = $<<{initial_bill}-{total_purchases_cost}={money_left_over}>>{money_left_over} left over
